text: On the fourth day, God created the sun, moon and stars for the following purposes except

options.A: to separate the day from the night
options.B: for signs of seasons, days and years
options.C: to give light upon the earth
options.D: to dry up flood from the face of the earth

explanation: This can be found in the creation story in Genesis. In the biblical narrative, God created the sun, moon, and stars on the fourth day of creation to give light upon the earth, to separate between day and night and to serve as signs of seasons, days, and years. It was not originally created to dry up the flood from the surface of the earth.
